TopicTitle: A New Customer or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Job

Articles.Content:
So, after an hounorable discharge from the FDF (after completing my conscription), I looked for a job in order to fill the gap between service and proper studies. I happened to fall into the bottomless abyss of a mailmans occupation. ItÃ‚Â´s hard work with somewhat meager pay, however you get to see society from quite a different perspective. Not to mention all the whacky encounters that occasionally come by.

Last week wasnÃ‚Â´t any different. Or so I tought until thursday. "Pics or it didnÃ‚Â´t happen", they say around some parts of the interwebs.

EDIT: So you were part of the Finnish Defense Forces? I salute thee.

So you were part of the Finnish Defense Forces? I salute thee.

Yeah, we have conscription in effect around here. ItÃ‚Â´s really the only way to guarantee a force large enough to provide some kind of deterrent. Served 362 days in the Coastal Jaegers and was promoted to sergeant and designated as a sniper squad leader. Now IÃ‚Â´m in the reserve with more than 300,000 others. From time to time IÃ‚Â´m considering to enlist into peacekeeping, not really planning to leave right away, but one day I shall.
